issue.title: [Python] Add a "made-up" feature for the guide tutorial
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14977](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14977). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
To create a guide tutorial for a simple Python feature I will add a made-up function to `compute.py` in order to demonstrate the process of making a first contribution.

The function will call `min_max` and increase the interval for 1 in both directions. I would call the new function `tutorial_example`.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14977?focusedCommentId=17452993) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
What do you think about this feature `[~amol-]`?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14977?focusedCommentId=17454055) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
`[~amol-]` `[~jorisvandenbossche]` MinMaxOptions are not yet set in compute.py and I can’t find an issue for it. Is this for some reason or am I missing something?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14977?focusedCommentId=17454533) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
Update: MinMaxOptions have been changed to ScalarAggregateOptions in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9758/files#diff-694a635f185cf0d22dd6eefd91acedb48ed0bf71b15fd591aa6e7c508ba4cb09

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14977?focusedCommentId=17464527) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
Issue resolved with https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11900 and the Tutorial being merged https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14602.
